summary: This bill, the Compressed Gas Cylinder Safety and Oversight Improvements Act of 2025, mandates the Secretary of Transportation to regulate foreign manufacturers of compressed gas cylinders used for transporting hazardous materials in the United States. It outlines approval processes, including requirements for five-year approvals, facility inspections, and reevaluation requests. The bill also introduces new reporting requirements for manufacturers, public notification of applications, and a published list of approved manufacturers. Furthermore, it revises inspection regulations, cost recovery for inspections, to ensure the safety of compressed gas cylinders.
